intro: Hymenoxys glabra, commonly known as the smooth hymenoxys, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, displaying bright yellow flowers during the spring and early summer. Its smooth, glabrous leaves are a distinguishing feature, and it is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Hymenoxys glabra is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy plant in dry climates.
